intro: Isolepis kunthiana, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial grass-like plant native to wetland habitats in the Americas. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soils, forming dense clumps with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spike-like cluster of small, inconspicuous flowers. Isolepis kunthiana plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
